entry.title: Post-Quantum commit / reveal Fawkescoin variant as a soft fork
entry.summary: In a recent communication regarding the challenges faced by Fawkescoin, particularly focusing on its vulnerability to Denial of Service (DoS) attacks, a valuable resource was shared to offer insight into possible solutions and preventive measures. The recommended reading is a paper titled "Mave," published in 2012, which delves into the intricacies of DoS problems within systems similar to Fawkescoin, proposing methodologies and strategies to mitigate such risks effectively. This paper can be accessed via the provided link, offering a comprehensive examination and technical analysis aimed at enhancing the security and resilience of blockchain technologies against DoS attacks. For those interested in understanding or addressing the vulnerabilities of Fawkescoin or similar cryptocurrencies, the Mave paper serves as a critical resource. It not only outlines the nature of DoS threats but also introduces innovative approaches to safeguard digital assets against these potentially crippling attacks. The document is available for review and study at [this link](https://bitslog.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/mave1.pdf), promising valuable insights for developers, researchers, and enthusiasts in the field of cryptocurrency security.
